eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that simplifies the use of Log by improving the call to all log methods by supplying arguments as parameters instead of creating a string. This avoids useless memory allocations when not requested: the StringBuilder itself, the buffer and the String object. The new methods check in advance if the level is enabled and only after the string message with arguments is created.

    Note: This class has best usage with Log.

    Classical usage:

     if (BuildConfig.DEBUG) {
     Log.setLevel(Level.INFO);
 } else {
     Log.setLevel(Level.SUPPRESS);
 }
 Logger logger = new Logger("MyNewTag");

    Advanced usage:

    The Logger constructor will reset the Log.customTag to null!
    So at the next static call of Log.v/d/i/w/e(...); it will log the current filename as tag. 
     public class MyClass {
     private Logger logger;

     public MyClass() {
         if (Log.customTag == null) Log.useTag("MyClass");
         this.logger = new Logger(Log.customTag);
         ...
     }

     public static void useTag(String tag) {
         Log.useTag(tag);
     }
 }

 // Usage
 MyClass.useTag("MyNewSmartTag");
 MyClass myClass = new MyClass();
    Since:
    02/09/2017
    See Also:
    Log
